alert.note: Alert for Inland Wakulla (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 02 at 9:29AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend Florida, including the following areas, Inland Jefferson, Inland Wakulla, Leon and Madison and Georgia, including the following areas, Brooks, Decatur, Grady, Lowndes, Seminole and Thomas. * WHEN...Through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 AM EST, a heavy band of rain was expanding east toward Tallahassee and will continue to spread east toward Madison and Valdosta late this morning and early this afternoon. Rainfall rates and duration could bring runoff issues and isolated flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
